name: Mitchell Munoz
label: Python Programmer
summary: Python programming hobbyist in rural Guatemala.

projects.title: Flask Blog Application
projects.summary: Built and deployed a production-ready blog application by completing Miguel Grinberg’s Flask Mega-Tutorial, focusing on backend development, database design, authentication, and deployment pipelines.
highlights: Developed Flask-based web application with Jinja2 templates and user authentication
Implemented relational database schema and migrations using SQLAlchemy and Alembic
Wrote automated unit tests to validate application routes and database operations
Integrated external services for email notifications and user avatars (Gravatar)
Containerized the application with Docker and deployed to production using uWSGI behind Nginx
Configured GitHub Actions for continuous integration and deployment workflows

projects.title: Django Blog Application
projects.summary: Built a blog platform by completing Corey Schafer’s Django tutorials, focusing on Django’s built-in features and ORM.
highlights: Developed full-stack blog application using Django’s class-based views, templates, and URL routing
Implemented user registration, login/logout, and password reset with Django’s authentication system
Integrated Crispy Forms and Bootstrap to improve form handling and UI
Created relational database models and managed schema changes with Django migrations
Configured static and media file handling for user profile images
Leveraged Django signals to automate user profile creation and updates

work_experience.summary: Responsible for managing and maintaining the church’s computer networks, software, and technology infrastructure

volunteer_experience.summary: Helped serve with any computer problems for two hours each week. Mainly helped with networking, typing, basic instruction, and troubleshooting.
